intro: Sipanea trichantha, commonly known as the hairy sipanea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Sipanea trichantha is native to southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
